newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian stocks dip at open after Dow shakes.
newsitem.headline: Australian stocks dip at open after Dow shakes.

text.p: Australian shares opened slightly weaker on Friday after Wall Street experienced a volatile session with the Dow reversing a 96 point plunge to close only slightly weaker.
At 10.15 a.m. (2315 GMT), the All Ordinaries index was 2.6 points lower at 2,408.6.
Early trading saw blue chip issues narrowly mixed with the industrial sector slightly firmer but resources weaker despite the stronger performance of base metal prices on Thursday.

"The market has been fairly cautious this morning and it should stay this way for the rest of the day. I don't think too many people will go long into the weekend given the volatility of the Dow last night," a dealer from a Melbourne-based brokerage said.
The dealer said investors also had one eye on a weaker local bond market after U.S. bonds slid on a stronger than expected rise in manufacturing activity.

Leading the market lower were Australia's largest company BHP, and major property and finance group, Lend Lease Corp, while some banks, including ANZ, Advance and St George, found a reasonable level of buying support early.
At 11.10 a.m. (0010 GMT), ANZ Bank was one cent higher at A$7.95 (US$6.28), Advance shares were seven cents up at A$7.00 and St George shares up two cents at A$7.82.
